intro: Reutera caroides, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical significance in Māori culture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Reutera caroides is also valued for its fibrous leaves, which have been used traditionally for weaving and basket-making.
